item.title: By: Ben Hong
item.dc:creator: Ben Hong
item.description: I hear you man. Sometimes I get so caught up in trying to find the best move or trying to get 100% efficiency that it just gets overwhelming. Glad that the post was helpful. Hope all is well man!
item.content:encoded: I hear you man. Sometimes I get so caught up in trying to find the best move or trying to get 100% efficiency that it just gets overwhelming. Glad that the post was helpful. Hope all is well man!

item.title: By: Aaron Murg
item.dc:creator: Aaron Murg
item.description: I'm right there with you, but with more moves than just the 3-4 pincer! I have an instructor that says to simply find the best move that benefits you. That in and of itself makes sense. It also relieves the pressure I sometimes feel to just start busying myself with memorization. But at the same time, how do you know what's the best move in the beginning. Understanding is better than memorization sure. But understanding is not as easy to come by as memorization in my experience. Thanks Ben!
item.content:encoded: I’m right there with you, but with more moves than just the 3-4 pincer! I have an instructor that says to simply find the best move that benefits you. That in and of itself makes sense. It also relieves the pressure I sometimes feel to just start busying myself with memorization. But at the same time, how do you know what’s the best move in the beginning. Understanding is better than memorization sure. But understanding is not as easy to come by as memorization in my experience. Thanks Ben!

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: To be honest, it very well might have been. The only problem is that I didn't really respond well to the Get Strong at Joseki series since my knowledge was quite limited and the methodology wasn't suited to my learning style. In case you're thinking about getting it though, it seems to be more promising than the original Dictionary of Basic Joseki by Yoshida Ishio 9p since its more contemporary and pretty straightforward. I'll be sure to post a review once I've gotten a better handle on it.
item.content:encoded:
To be honest, it very well might have been. The only problem is that I didn’t really respond well to the Get Strong at Joseki series since my knowledge was quite limited and the methodology wasn’t suited to my learning style.
In case you’re thinking about getting it though, it seems to be more promising than the original Dictionary of Basic Joseki by Yoshida Ishio 9p since its more contemporary and pretty straightforward. I’ll be sure to post a review once I’ve gotten a better handle on it.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Bummer on that. I think offering a package for subscribing to both would actually help boost sales. Just my two cents though.
item.content:encoded: Bummer on that. I think offering a package for subscribing to both would actually help boost sales. Just my two cents though.

item.title: By: Todd Lee Rainey
item.dc:creator: Todd Lee Rainey
item.description: I'm very jealous that you were able to get that book! My own library has helped me immensely, but it is much too small. Was this not covered in Get Strong at Joseki?
item.content:encoded:
I’m very jealous that you were able to get that book! My own library has helped me immensely, but it is much too small.
Was this not covered in Get Strong at Joseki?

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: No worries! Thanks again for the surprise and I will be sure to post about how it goes!
item.content:encoded: No worries! Thanks again for the surprise and I will be sure to post about how it goes!

item.title: By: Darrell Malick
item.dc:creator: Darrell Malick
item.description: Sorry, I was offline for a few days. I see the question has already been answered. I just sent a little something your way in an email. Enjoy!
item.content:encoded: Sorry, I was offline for a few days. I see the question has already been answered. I just sent a little something your way in an email. Enjoy!

item.title: By: Jeromie Rand
item.dc:creator: Jeromie Rand
item.description: If you haven't subscribed to either the training system or the lectures they list the price for each set and the price for buying them both at the same time, but there is no discount for buying them together.
item.content:encoded: If you haven’t subscribed to either the training system or the lectures they list the price for each set and the price for buying them both at the same time, but there is no discount for buying them together.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I saw that on the site, but at one point I remember there was a table charting out how much the training system would cost and then how much it would cost in combination with the lectures. Maybe I'm just imagining things though....
item.content:encoded: I saw that on the site, but at one point I remember there was a table charting out how much the training system would cost and then how much it would cost in combination with the lectures. Maybe I’m just imagining things though….

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I'm running into some issues with that as well. Just like you said though, just focus on understanding the basic ones. Otherwise, don't sweat it. With each step we'll get stronger!
item.content:encoded: I’m running into some issues with that as well. Just like you said though, just focus on understanding the basic ones. Otherwise, don’t sweat it. With each step we’ll get stronger!
